NONPROFITS · DONATION DATA

Every Extra Click Loses Donations

Nonprofit friend complained: "Our website doesn't convert donations." Checked donation flow: 7 clicks from homepage to completed donation. 3 page loads. Created account required. Month tracking: 1,200 started donation, 87 completed. That's 93% drop-off. Simplified to: click "Donate" → enter amount → pay. 3 clicks. Week 1: 217 donations from same traffic. Donation friction is donor repellent. Every barrier costs your mission money.

Unexpected Findings From Nonprofit Website Testing

What nobody tells nonprofits about websites

!

7-click donation flow: 93% donor drop-off

Nonprofit had: homepage → "about us" → "our mission" → "ways to give" → "donation options" → "create account" → "payment" → "confirm." 7 clicks, 3 page loads. 1,200 visitors started donation flow, 87 completed. Simplified to: "Donate" button → amount → pay. 3 clicks. Same traffic: 217 completed. 93% drop-off vs 46% drop-off. Donation friction = donor loss.

!

No recurring giving: 83% one-time only

Nonprofit only accepted one-time donations. Analysis: 83% of donors gave once, never again. Added monthly recurring option: "$10/month provides meals for a family every month." Month 1: 47% of new donors chose recurring. One $10/month donor = $120 lifetime value vs $10 one-time. Recurring revenue = predictable budget = stable mission impact.

!

Statistics vs stories: 3x donation difference

Nonprofit homepage: "We've served 10,000 people since 2015." Vague. Abstract. Changed to: "Meet Maria. After 6 months living in her car, Maria found housing through our program. She's now employed and reunited with her children." Specific. Human. Month 1: donations increased 3x. Donors give to people, not statistics. Stories show impact. Numbers count people.

!

No nonprofit discount: paying full price unnecessarily

Nonprofit paid $27/month for Wix. No discount applied. Applied for Wix nonprofit program: 50% discount = $13.50/month. $324 saved over 2 years. That's 324 meals for hungry people. Webflow: 50% discount = $106/month saved. Many builders don't advertise discounts but offer them when asked. Never pay full price as a nonprofit. That money funds your mission.

!

Hidden donation button: lost 67% potential donors

Nonprofit buried donation button in navigation submenu. "Who We Are," "What We Do," "Get Involved," then "Donate." A/B test: moved "Donate" button to header, bright color, always visible. Month-over-month: donations up 67%. Same traffic. Same mission. Better visibility. Donation button should be above fold, obvious, on every page. Don't make donors hunt.

Quick reality check: Nonprofits live on donations. Every barrier in your donation flow loses donors. Every click, every page load, every required field = donor drop-off. Build for frictionless giving: prominent donation button, simple form, recurring option, instant receipt. Optimized donation flow = more mission impact. Poor donation flow = money left on table that could change lives.

What actually matters for nonprofits

Frictionless donation flow is not optional

3 clicks max: donation button → amount → pay. That's it. No account creation. No navigation through multiple pages. No unnecessary fields. Every extra step loses donors. Wix and Squarespace have built-in donation processing with optimized flows. Custom integrations often add friction. Test your donation flow yourself. Count the clicks. If it's more than 3, you're losing money.

Recurring donations = predictable budget

One-time donors = unpredictable revenue. Monthly givers = stable budget you can plan around. Offer recurring options prominently. "$10/month feeds a family every month" beats "$10 donation." Specific monthly impact = commitment. Most donation processors support recurring. Wix Payments, Squarespace, Stripe all handle it. Enable recurring. Recurring donors give 4x more over their lifetime than one-time donors.

Stories show impact, statistics count people

"We've served 10,000 people" is abstract. "Meet Maria, who found housing after 6 months homeless" is tangible. Donors give to people, not statistics. Combine both: "We've helped 10,000 people like Maria find housing." Stats provide scope. Stories provide humanity. Use both. Stories inspire, statistics validate.

Nonprofit discounts matter

Webflow and Wix: 50% nonprofit discount

Webflow: 50% off for qualifying nonprofits. That's $106/month saved on their $212 plan. Wix: 50% off with application. Squarespace: occasional nonprofit pricing, ask sales. These discounts aren't always advertised. Contact builders directly, ask for nonprofit pricing. TechSoup also offers discounted software for nonprofits. Never pay full price. That money funds your mission.

Budget options without discounts

If discounts aren't available or you need ultra-low-cost: Mixo at $9/month works well. Durable at $15/month includes CRM for donor management. Both are cheaper than discounted major builders. Trade-off: fewer features, less polish. For small nonprofits or volunteer-run orgs, budget options work. As you grow, upgrade to professional builders with nonprofit pricing.

Built-in CRM for donor management

Durable includes built-in CRM. Track donors, manage donations, send follow-ups. For nonprofits without dedicated donor software, this is huge value. Otherwise you're paying for website builder + separate donor CRM. All-in-one saves money and reduces complexity. Wix has Wix CRM. Squarespace integrates with donor platforms. Consider donor management when choosing.

Things that drove me crazy

Always ask for nonprofit discount

Many builders don't advertise discounts but will offer 30-50% off if asked. Webflow and Wix both have 50% nonprofit programs. Never pay full price as a nonprofit.

Donation friction costs donations

Every extra click in donation flow loses donors. Built-in donation tools (Wix, Squarespace) convert better than third-party embeds. Test your donation flow yourself.

Stories > statistics for donors

"We helped 1,000 people" is abstract. "Meet Maria, who found housing after 6 months homeless" is tangible. Donors give to people, not statistics.

Building a nonprofit site? Check the full reviews for donation flow examples, nonprofit discount details, and the features that actually convert visitors into donors.
